entry.name: 104apci-unnumbered-startdt-act

entry.name: alaris-dcmp
entry.description: A medical protocol used by the PC Unit 8015 component of the BD Alaris modular IV Infusion Therapy Systems to communicate with the Alaris management server to wirelessly transmits key drug and IV therapy data.

entry.name: alipay
entry.description: Alipay is an online and mobile payment application from China. It integrates functionalities including electronic payment, online banking, and financial services. This App-ID covers the traffic of Alipay on mobile and Web paltform.

entry.name: aporeto
entry.description: Aporeto is a Zero Trust security solution for microservices, containers and the cloud. This App covers Aporeto enforcer traffic, in which cryptographically signed JSON Web Token (JWT) is inserted in TCP handshake to authenticate and authorize the flow.

entry.name: avid-nexis
entry.description: Avid NEXIS is the next generation of shared storage for media applications, and continues the Avid ISIS tradition of highly-scalable storage system based on a parallel file system that meets the latency constraints of media applications found in the most demanding post production and broadcast environments.

entry.name: aws-iot
entry.description: This app-id covers traffic from Amazon Web Service IoT devices.

entry.name: azure-govt-cloud-storage
entry.description: Azure Government is a separate instance of the Microsoft Azure service. Microsoft Azure Government delivers a cloud platform built upon the foundational principles of security, privacy and control, compliance, and transparency. This application identifies the Cloud storage platform of Microsoft Azure Government.

entry.name: bacnet-abort
entry.description: This App-ID provides operate functional control over bacnet. BACnet, an ASHRAE building automation and control networking protocol, was designed specifically to meet the communication needs of building automation and control systems for applications such as heating, ventilating, and air-conditioning control, lighting control, access control, and fire detection systems and their associated equipment. This functional app detects bacnet abort response.

entry.name: baxter-sigma-xml
entry.description: A medical protocol used by Baxter Sigma Spectrum and Spectrum IQ infusion pumps to communicate with the Care Everywhere infusion pump gateway server.

entry.name: capsule-neuron
entry.description: The Capsule Neuron is a bedside device that enables automatic collection of vital signs data. It features local data storage, and connects to the hospital network through a wired Ethernet or a standard 802.11 b/g/n wireless network.

entry.name: cip-ethernet-ip-list-identity
entry.description: This App-ID provides operate functional control over EtherNet/IP. EtherNet/IP was introduced in 2001 and today is the most developed, proven and complete industrial Ethernet network solution available for manufacturing automation. EtherNet/IP is a member of a family of networks that implements the Common Industrial Protocol (CIP) at its upper layers. CIP encompasses a comprehensive suite of messages and services for a variety of manufacturing automation applications, including control, safety, synchronization, motion, configuration and information. As a truly media-independent protocol that is supported by hundreds of vendors around the world, CIP provides users with a unified communication architecture throughout the manufacturing enterprise. This protocol is typically used in Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) and Industrial Control System (ICS) applications.

entry.name: cloudme
entry.description: CloudMe is a file storage service that offers cloud storage, file synchronization and client software.

entry.name: desktop-central
entry.description: Desktop Central is a unified endpoint management solution by ManageEngine that helps in managing servers, laptops, desktops, smartphones, and tablets from a central location.

entry.name: dns-over-https
entry.description: DNS Queries over HTTPS (DoH) is a protocol for sending DNS queries and getting DNS responses over HTTPS. For the ssl traffic coverage, this appid now only covers dns.google.com, cloudflare-dns.com, and doh.powerdns.org . It does not cover DoH servers setup by privates.

entry.name: dns-over-tls
entry.description: DNS over TLS (DoT) is a security protocol for encrypting and wrapping Domain Name System (DNS) queries and answers via the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol. Decrypted traffic will be covered by dns appid, and this appid only covers the ssl traffic google, cloudflare and quad9. If a private DNS over TLS server is setup then this App-ID cannot identify that traffic without decryption.

entry.name: docsend
entry.description: Docsend is a plateform where you can securely upload and share the documents. This App-ID covers the traffic of accessing, login and uploading in Docsend.

entry.name: firebase-cloud-messaging
entry.description: Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) is a cross-platform messaging solution provided by Google. It is typically used to send notification and push message with payload up to 4KB to client applications. This App-ID covers the traffic of FCM activities in client application.

entry.name: flipgrid
entry.description: Flipgrid is a video discussion platform for educators, students, and families. This app-id identifies traffic from the flipgrid web-browser client.

entry.name: fmtp
entry.description: FMTP is Flight Message Transfer Protocol used in a peer-to-peer communications context for the information exchange between flight data processing systems.

entry.name: ge-cic-xml

entry.name: ge-hilltop
entry.description: A medical protocol used by GE MAC-series of ECGs (electrocardiograms) to wirelessly communicate with the GE MUSE cardiology information system in order to capture, transmit and analyze your patients' ECG information. [source - https://www.silextechnology.com/resources/case-studies/ge-healthcare-mobilelink-wireless-ecg-communication]

entry.name: ge-rwhat
entry.description: A GEHC medical protocol used by the Carescape line of physiological patient monitors. All monitoring devices on the GE Unity Network periodically broadcast information about themselves in "RWHAT" packets. Among other things, RWHAT packets contain IP address, port number, name and offered services information about each device.

entry.name: mycase
entry.description: Mycase is an online management platform for case documents, messages, and contacts for lawyers. This app-id identifies traffic from the mycase web-browser client.

entry.name: myownconference
entry.description: Myownconference is a software for online training, webinars and conferencing. This app-id identifies traffic from the myownconference client.

entry.name: ncipher-impath
entry.description: Impath is a proprietary protocol owned by nCipher and it enables a secure tunnel between HSM Clients and HSM's performing hardware encryption key management.

entry.name: nerohut
entry.description: NeroHut is a javascript miner that is embedded in websites and uses CPU resources while you visit such sites to mine the monero cryptocurrency. This App-ID identifies such mining activity giving you the ability to get visibility into such traffic and block it in an enterprise environment.

entry.name: newrow
entry.description: Newrow Inc., a browser-based, video collaboration company specializing in connecting instructors with large groups of students in interactive classrooms online. It is an online teaching platform built with HTML5 and WebRTC.

entry.name: oneup
entry.description: Oneup is an all-in-one business management software. This app-id identifies traffic from the oneup web-browser client.

entry.name: onvif
entry.description: ONVIF (Open Network Video Interface Forum) is a global and open industry forum with the goal of facilitating the development and use of a global open standard for the interface of physical IP-based security products. ONVIF creates a standard for how IP products within video surveillance and other physical security areas can communicate with each other. ONVIF is an organization started in 2008 by Axis Communications, Bosch Security Systems and Sony.This appid covers the traffic for HTTP/ONVIF.

entry.name: paloalto-dns-security
entry.description: Palo Alto Network's DNS Security service is a cloud-based analytics platform which provides your firewall with access to DNS signatures generated using advanced predictive analysis and machine learning, with malicious domain data from a growing threat intelligence sharing community.

entry.name: parim
entry.description: Parim is a staff and employee management and scheduling software. This app-id identifies traffic from the parim web-browser client.

entry.name: pipedrive
entry.description: Pipedrive is a web-based Sales CRM and pipeline management solution that helps businesses to plan their sales activities and monitor deals.

entry.name: pipelinedeals
entry.description: Pipelinedeals is an online CRM software to manage sales and company relations. This app-id identifies traffic from the pipelinedeals web-browser client.

entry.name: poct1-a
entry.description: Point-of-care Connectivity approved standard published by CLSI. The standard permits medical point-of-care devices from different manufacturers to communicate with laboratory and hospital information systems. [source – "An Executive's Guide to Information Technology: Principles, Business Models ..."]

entry.name: rainbow
entry.description: Alcatel-Lucent Rainbow™ is a cloud-based, enterprise-grade, Unified Communication as a Service (UCaaS) and Communication Platform as a Service (CPaaS) that connects people and systems within an organization. This AppID identifies traffic from the rainbow web-browser client.

entry.name: recruitee
entry.description: Recruitee is Software as a service (Saas) that functions as an applicant tracking system (ATS). This app-id identifies traffic from the recruitee web-browser client.

entry.name: recurly

entry.description: gRPC is an open source remote procedure call (RPC) protocol initially developed by Google. gRPC operates based on HTTP/2 and Protocol Buffers, provides cross-platform and cross-language RPC services. This App-ID covers the traffic of communication between gRPC client and server.

entry.name: niagara-fox
entry.description: The Niagara Framework includes a proprietary protocol called Fox which is used for all network communication between stations as well as between Workbench and stations. Fox is a multiplexed peer to peer protocol that sits on top of a TCP connection.

entry.name: opc-ua-acknowledge
entry.description: OLE for Process Control (OPC), which stands for Object Linking and Embedding (OLE) for Process Control, is the original name for a standards specification developed in 1996 by an industrial automation industry task force and used in SCADA networks. This functional app detects OPC Unified Architecture Acknowledge Response.

entry.name: opc-base
entry.description: OLE for Process Control (OPC), which stands for Object Linking and Embedding (OLE) for Process Control, is the original name for a standards specification developed in 1996 by an industrial automation industry task force and used in SCADA networks. The standard specifies the communication of real-time plant data between control devices from different manufacturers. As of November 2011, the OPC Foundation has officially renamed the acronym to mean "Open Platform Communications".

entry.name: siemens-p2
entry.description: P2 is a Siemens proprietary protocol, used by controllers and DDCs of the Apogee Building Management System (BMS). It is used for communication between controllers and the Insight servers as part of the "Building Level Network" (BLN) to exchange process data and configuration and programming of the controllers. This appid covers traffic for p2 protocol.
